page.title: 12BLACK ROAD DEVELOPMENT
page.content: Black Road is residential. It has 87 houses; 11 detached, 22 semi detached, 52 terraced and 2 bungalows. This includes the Black Road No.2 General Improvement Area where early C19 terraced property was collectively modernised, maintaining a close community spirit. HRH the Prince of Wales visited Black Road on 8th February,1985. 32 new properties are being built at Roan Court on original Water Board land. The Community Centre (& Polling Station) provides leisure facilities for the elderly and youth groups. There is one shop and one public house-The Navigation. Black Road is situated a mile from Macclesfield town centre and within 3 miles of The Peak District National Park.
